column1: inswinger angling into him but too straight, and Shaw clips it off his pads to deep square leg. Rashid gives chase and pulls it in just in front of the boundary
length ball angling across him, pushed to point

outside edge flies to the boundary got it to bounce a little extra off a length, angling across and Dhawan was surprised by it, was looking to push at it, takes the shoulder of the bat and flies off. Warner's at first slip but even he can't get to it with a dive
length ball on off, pushed to mid-off
fuller outside off, he taps it to cover off the front foot
good length, stump to stump, Dhawan wants to tap it into the offside and run, but there is no run there
full and well outside off, Shaw reaches for it with feet not moving, but doesn't connect
back of a length in the corridor, Shaw rises up on his toes and taps it into the offside for a quick single

down the track and over the in-field reached the pitch of the ball outside off and wanted to go straighter than he ended up, splices it but over cover. Another long chase and the ball is pulled in, in front of the extra cover boundary

got him extra bounce does the trick. Kept it on a hard length but close to the off stump, not at cutting width. Shaw went for the cut anyway, but only ends up edging it behind. Khaleel's successful immediately on his return
nipping into him from a length outside off, he wanted to work it away but it takes the thigh pad and rolls to short third man. Dhawan charges for a quick single
good length on off stump, defended towards mid-off

no slip and the edge goes for four Wonder why the slip was removed. The extra bounce has got two edges already. This one did it again, bounced outside off from back of a length and Munro slashed hard at it. Got a thick outside edge that ran to the boundary
good length, punched to cover
good length, tight line on the stumps, pushed back to the bowler's left
too full and a slower ball, Munro picked that up easily. Waited and drove it crisply through extra cover for a boundary
good length on leg stump, cramps him for room, pushed to mid-on
good length, angling into him, punched back to the bowler

bouncer gets him Khaleel Ahmed is having a great comeback. Banged this in short and got it to climb over the shoulder outside off. Bad choice of shot from Dhawan, trying to pull it from just over shoulder height outside off. Sends it more high than far, and Bhuvneshwar at fine leg settles under the looping ball to hold it safely, after a small juggle
good length, nipping into him again and cramping him for room. Pushed to the bowler's left
slightly too short and Munro pounces on it. Given room too, outside off and he frees his arms to drive it forcefully through cover
bang that's Munro's power on show. A little too full outside off and he plays a pick-up flick almost, hits it hard enough to carry all the way over square leg
length ball outside off, steered to short third man
strays on the pads and tucked to deep square leg
good length outside off, steered to point
good length outside off, he opens the face of the bat to run it down to third man
bouncer, but too short and sails over his head. That will be wide
yorker outside off, sneaks through under his bat. He was looking to run it down to third man
good length on the stumps, punched to mid-off and they set off for a quick run. Williamson runs in and under-arms it directly to the stumps while diving forward, but Munro had made his ground

another boundary off an outside edge Full on the fifth stump line, draws him into the drive but gets an outside edge that just eludes Warner, diving to his right, at a widish slip. Bhuvneshwar has had no luck with edges today so far
walloped Slower ball, picked it up again, waltzed down the track and picked it up to loft it over long on
good length coming into him, tucked around the corner to deep square leg
too short and outside off, he goes for the cut, but finds point

angling into him, defends with soft hands to silly point and they run for a quick single. Early call and they would have made it, even if there was a direct hit by the fielder running in to under-arm it

another boundary that's not controlled. digs it in short, Munro is on the front foot and he is forced into an ungainly duck while trying to pull, gets a top edge that goes very fine. Nobody there so it will be four runs
another short ball, this time he sways out of the way
length ball, gets it to turn a bit, worked away between midwicket and mid-on
length ball angling into him, comes on the front foot to push to mid-off
flatter angled into the pads, and he punches it to long-on
too short, and Iyer spots it, makes room and cuts it powerfully to the point boundary. Despairing dive by the fielder but he can't stop the boundary despite getting a hand to the ball
fullish, clipped to long-on
given some air on the stumps, he stays still and slaps it to deep extra cover
length ball outside off, Munro goes on on knee to swat a sweep to deep midwicket
good length on the stumps, Iyer goes back and flicks it to square leg
well bowled, he spotted Munro charging down the track and shortened his length while keeping it close to the batsman's body. Munro can only push it to long-off
goes back and across again to flick it to deep square leg

nails the shot coming down the track this time Delayed his shimmy a tad, and Abhishek couldn't adjust his length. Munro dances down and gets it in the slot, picks it up for a mighty hit way over long -on

the bowler has the last laugh! He's bowled a leg-cutter with back-spin, which is a smart thing to do with Munro looking to hit with the one spinning into him. He bowls this wider of the stumps too, and Munro wants to slap this hard, but the spin ends up taking it a bit away from him and he gets a thin edge through to the keeper. Good catch by Bairstow
good length on the stumps, punched down the ground
good length, angling across, driven to long-off
peachy too full outside off and Iyer leans into a picture perfect extra cover drive that beats the in-field and purrs all the way to the boundary
fullish length outside off, steered to third man off the front foot
angled across again, Pant has room outside off to free his arms and drive fluently, but can't get past a tumbling extra cover, who dives to his left to stop the ball
too straight, on the pads, and tucked to fine leg
smashed too short, loosener from Rashid first up, and Pant smacks a pull to the square leg boundary
length ball, given some air on leg stump. Wanted to tickle it fine but it pops up to where leg slip would have been
beauty pitches outside off, draws him forward and riffs past the outside edge
well played by Iyer, flighted ball outsdie off, he stayed in his crease, took a stride out and opened the face to run it down to the third man boundary
too short again and Iyer rocks back to pull, but there is a sweeper at midwicket who tidies up
length ball, he goes on the back foot to defend
length on the pads, Iyer plays way in front of his body and turns the face too early, the ball lobs up towards midwicket but there was nobody stationed to catch it and what's more, they take two
length on the pads, tucked away to deep squareleg
length on the pads, tucked away to deep midwicket for one
length on middle, Iyer makes room and then opens the face of the bat to guide it along the ground to third-man
length on off, steered to point
full outside off, Pant throws his bat at it with his head falling away, gets a genuine outside edge but there's no slip at this stage of the game, and the ball races away to the third-man fence
googly on off, turns back in, Iyer watches it closely onto his bat and pats it back
shorter on middle, quicker one, skids through a little, pushed to midwicket

stifled appeal from the keeper, more for the beauty of a delivery than any real chance of a wicket! Full on off, looked to turn it to the legside, squared him up completely and took the pad on the way to short third-man
full on the pads, tucked away to deep midwicket
beaten! Full outside off, played for the googly with a closed face again and beaten comprehensively on the outside edge
short, googly, picks it up early, rocks back and hammers it towards deep midwicket
length on the pads, Pant walks across further, which probably did not allow the bat access to come through, gets a leg bye to squareleg
short ball at the body as Iyer looks to back away but eventually ducks under it

another short one, Iyer rolls his wrists over it and pulls it away to deep squareleg for one. There's a direct hit from the boundary at the non striker's end but the ricochet doesn't cost the sunrisers
short outside off, Pant rocks back and cuts it poiwerfully through point, Rashid Khan makes a valiant attempt diving to his left on the boundary but in vain
length on off, pushed to cover for a quick single
slower ball on the pads, tucked away to deep squareleg
full outside off, draws him forward and pushed to point
full outside off, Iyer comes forward slightly tentatively again, gets an outside edge along the ground to short third-man
short around the hip, helped along the ground to deep squareleg
length on off, waits for it before pushing it to cover
full on off, comes forward and pushes it to long-on
short on middle, googly, slower in pace, Pant looks to hammer a pull, doesn't get enough of it but gets a single to deep midwicket
yorker on leg stump as Pant back away outside leg stump but adjusts and pushes it to long-on
length and down the leg side, perhaps put off by Iyer moving around the crease
short slower ball outside off, well disguised, Iyer late to pick it up tries to control the pull but misses it completely
yorker on leg stump as Iyer backs away, adjusts and pushes it to point with an open face
full outside off, almost a Kedar Jadhav like round-arm release, not allowing the batsman to get under it, pushed down the ground
full on the pads, clipped to long-on's right and they come through for two
full toss on middle, pushed to long-on for one
length down the leg side, Iyer looks to help it along but fails to make connection, it takes the pad on the way to the diving keeper, who fumbles and allows a leg bye
slower short one outside off, holds in the pitch a little, slashed away aerially to deep point but on the bounce
short one at the body, quick delivery, it's a length that can trouble Iyer, he's late on it as he goes for the pull, gets it on the splice and nearly lobs back to the bowler
length outside off, bit of width, Iyer punches it off the backfoot to the right of deep cover, who puts in a timely dive to keep them down to two

short, edged and gone! Iyer tried to back away and upper cut it but it didn't quite come on, there was tennis-ball like bounce on offer, and Iyer couldn't get enough on it to clear the keeper, who took it comfortably
length outside off, slashed away down to third-man for one
slower ball outside off, punched to deep cover for one

another one-handed shot from Pant leads to his dismissal at a highly inopportune moment! It was a low full toss, Pant had no chance to get under it but tried anyway, took it from well in front of the body, which meant that he couldn't get any power behind the stroke and just spoons a simple catch to long-on
length on middle, another check drive goes aerially towards long-on but on the bounce this time
short and fast, the batsman ducks under it
short outside off, Axar has a slash but is beaten by the extra bounce
length on the pads, tucked away to fine-leg
slower ball outside off, pushes at it but only manages an inside edge back to the bowler
length on middle but nearly through him, gets an inside edge past his leg stump
length on middle, Morris looks to pull but it hurries on to him and he gets an inside edge back onto his body
full outside off, drilled along the ground to long-off
googly on leg stump, spinning away slowly, pushed to long-on using his wrists
was that a chance? googly, Morris looks to cut and gets an outside edge, Bairstow can't hold on
didn't matter after all! Length on off, Morris stays back as it hurries on to him and rushes through between bat and pad to crash into the stumps
yorker outside off, squeezes it away towards cover
short on middle, swivels nicely and pulls it along the ground to deep squareleg
full toss outside off, too much width and finally something for the Capitals to cheer about as he blasts this through the covers for four
slower ball outside off, Axar goes for an ugly heave, doesn't get much on it as it trickles away to long-on for one
appeal for lbw turned down as the batsman walked across and tried to tickle it fine. SRH review upon the bowler's insistence, and it would have missed leg
yorker on middle, clipped away to deep squareleg for one
yorker on leg stump, squeezed away towards long-on for a couple but it's a no-ball as there were only three men inside the circle
full outside off, hammered down the ground
slower ball outside off and he has really got hold of that, powerfully struck over deep midwicket
that's a toe-crusher that's been missing from Bhuvneshwar's repertoire for a bit! Right on target, tailing in on middle with the batsman hanging back, finds him plumb in front
full on off, pushed to cover
full on off, pushed to long-off
short ball, surprises Rabada who swings anyway, and manages to get a single to deep midwicket
length ball, angling across, pushed to cover
fuller on the stumps, clipped off his toes to mid-on
length ball on the pads, Warner has tucked this to square leg with soft hands and he sprints between the wickets to steal a second. Amazing running
oooh there's the bounce and movement away from the left-hander. Good length, going across, bounces above waist height while jagging sharply off the seam
fuller that time on the stumps, pushed back to towards the bowler
back of a length, gets it to bounce to chest height at Warner, who goes up on his toes to dab it into the offside for a single
he's just gone for it, swatted this length ball hard, gets a thickish under-edge that races to the sauare leg fence
given some room outside off and he chops it hard to point

half chance put down by Rabada. Dug this in short and quick, Warner went for the pull, gets it very high on the bat and the ball pops back straight, dipping on Rabada in his follow through. He goes down but can only get a finger tip to it
swiped to mid-off for a quick single
strays in line, on the pads and all Bairstow has to do is tickle it fine. The fine leg is inside the circle, so no chance for any fielder to cut that off
on the pads again, Bairstow clips it off his pads to deep square leg that time
oooh in the corridor and he has Bairstow feeling for that one. Feet static, has a poke at it, doesn't get an edge, fortunately for him
yorker length, clipped off his toes to short midwicket
flays this over cover-point for a boundary. Ishant went a little too wide of off stump, and Bairstow jumped on the width offered
shot too full on the toes, and Bairstow plays a pick-up flick, timing it to perfection, and finding the deep midwicket boundary
good length on off, dabbed into the offside for a quick single
fuller on leg, Warner was looking to give himself room perhaps but Ishant speared it in. Warner ends up steering to point
width offered to Warner who slashes it to the man on the point boundary
good length outside off, driven off the back foot but straight to cover

that's lodged between Bairstow's thighs! good length coming in a touch, he wanted to whip it away but missed and the ball is stuck between his thighs. Morris appeals but that would have gone over the stumps
bludgeoned too full and Bairstow extends his arms for a free swing, sends it back straight, high, and handsome, into the sightscreen
length ball outside off, punched to cover
fuller length outside off, driven crisply off the front foot but straight to extra cover
Warner's trying to give himself room against Ishant, but Ishant's following him. Length ball on leg stump, tucks him up, he ends up jabbing it into the offside
terrific shot slightly slower, Bairstow waited a fraction and used his wrists to whip it off his toes to deep midwicket. Morris runs around and puts in a diving save
follows with a bouncer outside off but too high and that'll be a wide
under-edges it past the stumps and they steal a single! back of a length on off, he wanted to steer it away with a horizontal bat, but gets the bottom edge. The ball bounces and goes past the stumps
too full and Warner wanted to drill that back, but it was the slower one. Don't see those too often from Ishant and Warner didn't read it. Mistimes the drive to mid-on
nice work by short fine leg, Amit Mishra dives to his left to stop the ball. Short ball on leg stump, Warner swivels to pull, but thanks to Mishra, gets no runs
short one again, but on middle stump so he doesn't allow Warner to free his arms. He executes a short-arm pull to deep square leg
147 kph outside off. Warner was giving himself a lot of room, backing away, but Rabada keeps it on a sixth stump line and very full. Warner can't rech it
fuller on the stumps, Warner stays put this time and pushes it to mid-off for a single
he's straying on the pads to Bairstow, that's the third time. Nips in a bit and Bairstow just helps it along to deep square leg. Keemo Paul makes good ground to field the ball and prevent a boundary
back of a length outside off, punched to point
went for the yorker, ends up as a low full toss. Bairstow takes his top hand off while whipping it to midwicket. That was 152 kph!
strays on the pads again with that inward movement from a length and Bairstow whips it to deep square leg
wants to paddle this very fine from well outside off but misses it and it rolls off the pad
flatter on the stumps, pushed back to the bowler
back of a length outside off, he stays legside of the ball and punches between cover and point
outside edge goes for four given some more air, pitches and turns away. Bairstow wanted to force it through cover, ends up with an edge that goes fine. No slip of course
fuller, clipped to deep square leg
a little short, Warner made as if to reverse sweep, ends up conventionally sweeping. Good connection, but there is a deep square leg
back of a length angling across, gets it to bounce well too. Warner stays in his crease and cuts it to point
slower ball, completely beats Bairstow. Think Pant pinged the batsman on the head while trying to throw it back to the bowler
fuller, clipped to long-on

surprises him with the bounce and it lands safe between bowler and mid-off running in! short ball, Warner was shaping to tuck it, but again denied room. And the ball just reared up, took his top edge and looped up. Perfectly in no-man's land
flicked to square leg
another slower ball, back of a length outside off and Bairstow is too early into the cut, gets an under-edge to the keeper

right, Warner's had enough of hanging around and he absolutely clatters this several rows back into the deep midwicket boundary. Too short and he rocks back to generate immense power while dispatching the ball
gives himself some room and cuts this from outside off to deep point
good length on off, swipes it with a horizontal bat to long-off
too short again and Bairstow cashes in this time. Goes deep in his crease and clobbers this through midwicket
fuller on the stumps, he takes a big stride out and flicks it to long-on
flays this over cover, didn't get the timing quite right and it goes one bounce to Dhawan at deep cover
short, sits up and Warner swivels to pull it hard. There is protection though at deep square leg
full on the stumps, almost yorker length, turned off his toes to short fine leg
length ball outside off, slashed to cover off an under-edge
slower blal, but too short and sits up. Bairstow waits and pulls it to deep midwicket. And he's overstepped, so free hit coming up
down the track and clobbers it past the bowler straight. Didn't time it that well though, low full toss. Long-on ran around quickly to field
straight to Rabada at long-off bowled it very wide, just inside the tram-line, Bairstow went at it hard, but got only the toe-end. Another slower ball. He ends up hitting down the throat of long-off
off the mark with a clip to deep square leg
full outside off, pushed to cover
flatter on middle, pushed to long-on
full outside off, googly, pushed through cover
tossed up outside off, draws him forward,Williamson obliges and pushes it to point
googly, short outside off, cut away to deep point
googly, tossed up outside off, Williamson was shaping to drive it through the covers, adjusted his bat swing at the last moment and pushed it back to the bowler

length on the pads, clipped to deep midwicket, warner nearly turned blind for a second, Williamson sent him back, the throw came right on top of the stumps and Keemo Paul whipped the bails off at the non striker's end but Warner was back well in time
short ball outside off, Williamson attempts the ramp over the keeper but misses because of the slowness with which it arrives
full toss on middle, Williamson comes down the wicket and pushes it to cover

Rabada pulls of an excellent catch diving forward at mid-off! Well disguised slower ball, Williamson went for the lofted drive with the mid-off up, couldn't time it due to the slowness and ended up spooning it towards Rabada, who took it brilliantly, taking a few steps forward before diving
short ball at the batsman who ducks under and it was too high and called wide
full outside off, pushed to mid-off
slower ball outside off, steered to third-man
tossed up outside off, it's pretty slow so the batsman can hang back and push it past point for a couple
googly, tossed up, inviting him forward, doesn't pick it and gets an inside edge that goes past his leg stump for a couple
quicker one on the pads, pushed to midwicket
Munro has dropped that! Tossed up outside off, he went for the lofted shot down the ground, didn't get any elevation as it went flat down Munro's throat but burst through his fingers
full on middle, pushed to midwicket
googly on off, watches it closely onto his bat and pats it back
short on middle and Warner breaks the shackles with a short-arm pull
slower one on middle, grips a little, pushed through point for one
down the track comes Bhui, Morris follows him full, it comes tailing in and he gets an inside edge back on the pad
short at the body, pulled with no control in the air towards deep squareleg but on the bounce
full toss outside off and Warner blasts this one between mid-off, who is up in the circle and extra cover

nearly carries to deep midwicket! It was short on middle, didn't quite come on, Warner tried to control the pull shot but had already committed to it, but luckily for him, it wasn't very well timed and went on the bounce to the fielder
googly outside off, punched to long-off's right and the large field allows two
dropped, if it can be called that! Quicker one on middle, Warner hammers it back flat and hard, but it found Amit Mishra rather than the other way around. Couldn't quite get his hands around it
full on the pads, clipped to deep midwicket
short outside off, hammered along the ground to deep cover but only one
quicker one, almost a yorker, Warner pushes it past the diving bowler to his right and down to long-off to retain strike
full toss outside off, pushed to long-off
slower ball outside off and that ends an innings that has done SRH's chances more harm than good, looked to smash it into oblivion, ended up top edging it to point's left
length, cramping him up, tucked away to deep squarelg for one
full on the pads, clipped away towards squareleg
slower ball outside off, never arrives as Warner makes room to blast it through the off side and gets an outside edge on the bounce to the keeper
full toss outside off, Warner gets an outside edge to short third-man and it's only a single. The capitals continue to squeeze
length on middle, picks it up over the bowler's head and to long's right for two to bring up his fifty

Rabada wins the battle against Warner, but he has Keemo Paul, Amit Mishra and perhaps even Ricky Bhui to thank! Slower ball on middle, held in the surface, Warner tried to go over mid-off, who was in the circle but only had to take a couple of steps back to take and significantly dent SRH's chances

another one goes high up in the air and that could be the match! Short ball, Vijay Shankar has little choice but to attack, goes for the pull but with his weight forward is in position to execute it, only manages a top edge, called nice and early by the wicketkeeper
length on middle, pushed aerially towards long-on
full and straight, pushed back to the bowler
short ball on middle. slower ball, helped along to fine-leg
length on middle, swings to the leg side, it goes high in the air but falls in no man's land in the deep midwicket region
knocked him over as the leg stump goes cartwheeling! Perfect yorker, taling back in and through Deepak Hooda
length on middle, swung away towards deep squareleg and SRH are losing wickets in a clump with the required-rate climbing every ball. Chris Morris is on a hat-trick now as Rashid Khan holes out
yorker on off, pushed to extra cover
that's three in the over for Morris! Length on middle, tries to heave it to the leg side, gets it high on the bat and only manages to lob it up to extra cover
length on middle as he backs away and hangs his bat out but somehow finds the middle and gets a single to deep point
short ball, follows him as he backs away and misses the attempted ramp
full and straight and hammered back at the bowler
short slower ball, left alone and called wide for height
slower ball on a length, he goes for the hoick to the leg side, gets it on the splice and offers a high return catch to the bowler

bowled him! The perfect yorker to complete a perfect defence of what looked like a below-par score but has proved to be more than enough as the Capitals stretch their winning streak to three and SRH go down for the third time in succession
